oai_dc:dc.dc:title: George W. Teaford jacket
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jacket purportedly belonged to 1st Lt. George W. Teaford, Co. G, 58th Regt., Va. Vols. CSA. Born April 15, 1840. Lt. Teaford was killed at Battle of Port Republic in Virginia. Teaford was from Carter's Creek, Virginia and died June 10, 1862, from a; wound sustained in battle on June 9th. Teaford is one of 144 Confederate veterans buried in the Stonewall Jackson Memorial Cemetery in Lexington, Virginia. The jacket appears to be of postwar, non-military manufacture.
